byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.
byline.original: By ROD NORDLAND and JAWAD SUKHANYAR

abstract: Series of kidnappings and beheadings of members of Afghanistan's persecuted Hazara ethnic group by Taliban may be effort by insurgents to match Islamic State in its brutality; Shiite minority expresses fear and anger and is holding daily protests over government inaction.
lead_paragraph: Beheading is not normally a Taliban tactic, but the insurgents seem to be trying to make an exception for Hazaras, a persecuted minority in Afghanistan.

headline.main: Taliban Are Said to Target Hazaras to Try to Match ISIS’ Brutality
headline.print_headline: A Gruesome Message From the Taliban

snippet: Beheading is not normally a Taliban tactic, but the insurgents seem to be trying to make an exception for Hazaras, a persecuted minority in Afghanistan.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
